description: Thorium is a mildly radioactive metal more abundant than uranium and known for its potential role in next-generation nuclear reactors. Thorium-based fuel cycles promise cleaner waste profiles and enhanced safety, attracting interest from energy researchers. Historically, thorium appeared in gas mantles, specialty alloys, and high-temperature ceramics. Its chemical behavior resembles that of other actinides but with greater stability. Although thorium requires careful handling, its long-term radioactivity is significantly lower than many nuclear materials. Ongoing research explores its viability as a sustainable energy source, making thorium a notable candidate for future reactor technologies and advanced materials development.
name: Thorium
